p: In response to the rapid increase of human cases in Guangxi, local authorities temporarily closed LPMs, which was effective in reducing the risk of human infection. In addition, intensive media reports had strengthened public awareness of the risk of a A(H7N9) pandemic, particularly in rural areas. However, due to the traditional demand for fresh chicken meat among people living in the southern China, asymptomatic infection in poultry caused by the LPAI A(H7N9), and exposure pattern shift [ 2] , extensive efforts are needed to prevent and control A(H7N9) infection. These efforts could include active LPM surveillance and strengthening the immunization of poultry, which is considered to an extremely effective way to control the outbreak of avian influenza. [ 5]
